body_html:
@vadimkantorov I ran the following and pytorch succesfully compiled without issues. It's your exact environment as-is (gcc 5.4.0, cuda8). What am I missing?

nvidia-docker run -it --rm -v $(pwd):/remote nvidia/cuda:8.0-cudnn7-devel bash
apt update
apt install -y wget git
wget https://repo.continuum.io/miniconda/Miniconda2-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh && \
    chmod +x Miniconda2-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh && \
    ./Miniconda2-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh -b -p /opt/conda && \
    rm Miniconda2-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh
export PATH="/opt/conda/bin:$PATH"
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="/opt/conda"
conda install -y cmake mkl pyyaml magma-cuda80 -c pytorch
git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
cd pytorch
python setup.py build develop

@vadimkantorov I ran the following and pytorch succesfully compiled without issues. It's your exact environment as-is (gcc 5.4.0, cuda8). What am I missing?

```bash
nvidia-docker run -it --rm -v $(pwd):/remote nvidia/cuda:8.0-cudnn7-devel bash
apt update
apt install -y wget git
wget https://repo.continuum.io/miniconda/Miniconda2-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh && \
    chmod +x Miniconda2-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh && \
    ./Miniconda2-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh -b -p /opt/conda && \
    rm Miniconda2-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh
export PATH="/opt/conda/bin:$PATH"
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="/opt/conda"
conda install -y cmake mkl pyyaml magma-cuda80 -c pytorch
git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
cd pytorch
python setup.py build develop
```
